name: IUCN extinction risk category for iconic species
description:
International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Red List threat categories with aggregated species lists 

Data sources:

- [International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)](http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/classification-schemes/threats-classification-scheme)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global status was applied equally to all regions.

name: IUCN population trend as a proxy for iconic species trend
description:
International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Red List threat categories with aggregated species lists 

Data sources:

- [International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)](http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/classification-schemes/threats-classification-scheme)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: Areas of observed blast (dynamite) fishing
description:
The presence of destructive artisanal blast fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

Data sources:

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Areas of observed poison fishing
description:
The presence of destructive artisanal poison (cyanide) fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

Data sources:

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: High bycatch caused by artisanal fishing
description:
The presence of destructive artisanal blast and poison (cyanide) fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

Data sources:

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global pressures data were applied equally to all regions.

name: High bycatch artisanal fishing practices as a proxy for subtidal hard bottom habitat destruction
description:
The presence of destructive artisanal blast and poison (cyanide) fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

Data sources:

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global pressures data were applied equally to all regions.

name: Habitat extent * rank, per Carbon Storage habitats
description: Habitat extent * habitat rank for Carbon Storage habitats: mangrove, saltmarsh and seagrass
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global habitat extent was applied to each region after weighting by each region's offshore area to 3nm.
